 22  """factory methods to build real storage objects that conform to base.py""" 
 23   
 24  import os 
 25  from gzip import GzipFile 
 26  try: 
 27      # bz2 is not available on python 2.3 
 28      from bz2 import BZ2File 
 29  except ImportError: 
 30      BZ2File = None 
 31  import sys 
 32   
 33  from translate.storage import base 
 34  from translate.storage import csvl10n 
 35  from translate.storage import mo 
 36  from translate.storage import omegat 
 37  from translate.storage import po 
 38  from translate.storage import qm 
 39  from translate.storage import wordfast 
 40  #Let's try to import the XML formats carefully. They might fail if the user 
 41  #doesn't have lxml installed. Let's try to continue gracefully, but print an  
 42  #informative warning. 
 43  try: 
 44      #Although poxliff is unused in this module, it is referenced in test_factory 
 45      from translate.storage import poxliff 
 46      from translate.storage import qph 
 47      from translate.storage import tbx 
 48      from translate.storage import tmx 
 49      from translate.storage import ts2 as ts 
 50      from translate.storage import xliff 
 51      support_xml = True 
 52  except ImportError, e: 
 53      print >> sys.stderr, str(e) 
 54      support_xml = False 
 55   
 56   
 57  #TODO: Monolingual formats (with template?) 
 58   
 59  classes = { 
 60             "csv": csvl10n.csvfile,  
 61             "tab": omegat.OmegaTFileTab, "utf8": omegat.OmegaTFile, 
 62             "po": po.pofile, "pot": po.pofile,  
 63             "mo": mo.mofile, "gmo": mo.mofile,  
 64             "qm": qm.qmfile,  
 65             "_wftm": wordfast.WordfastTMFile, 
 66            } 
 67  """Dictionary of file extensions and their associated class.   
 68   
 69  _ext is a pseudo extension, that is their is no real extension by that name.""" 
 70   
 71  if support_xml: 
 72      classes.update({ 
 73             "qph": qph.QphFile, 
 74             "tbx": tbx.tbxfile, 
 75             "tmx": tmx.tmxfile,  
 76             "ts": ts.tsfile, 
 77             "xliff": xliff.xlifffile, "xlf": xliff.xlifffile, 
 78      }) 
 79   
 80  decompressclass = { 
 81      'gz': GzipFile, 
 82  } 
 83  if BZ2File: 
 84      decompressclass['bz2'] = BZ2File 
 85   

 86 -def _examine_txt(storefile): 

 87      """Determine the true filetype for a .txt file""" 
 88      if isinstance(storefile, basestring) and os.path.exists(storefile): 
 89          storefile = open(storefile) 
 90      try: 
 91          start = storefile.read(600).strip() 
 92      except AttributeError: 
 93          raise ValueError("Need to read object to determine type") 
 94      # Some encoding magic for Wordfast 
 95      if wordfast.TAB_UTF16 in start.split("\n")[0]: 
 96          encoding = 'utf-16' 
 97      else: 
 98          encoding = 'iso-8859-1' 
 99      start = start.decode(encoding).encode('utf-8') 
100      if '%Wordfast TM' in start: 
101          pseudo_extension = '_wftm' 
102      else: 
103          raise ValueError("Failed to guess file type.") 
104      storefile.seek(0) 
105      return pseudo_extension 

106   
107  hiddenclasses = {"txt": _examine_txt} 
108   

109 -def _guessextention(storefile): 

110      """Guesses the type of a file object by looking at the first few characters. 
111      The return value is a file extention .""" 
112      start = storefile.read(300).strip() 
113      if '<xliff ' in start: 
114          extention = 'xlf' 
115      elif 'msgid "' in start: 
116          extention = 'po' 
117      elif '%Wordfast TM' in start: 
118          extention = 'txt' 
119      elif '<!DOCTYPE TS>' in start: 
120          extention = 'ts' 
121      else: 
122          raise ValueError("Failed to guess file type.") 
123      storefile.seek(0) 
124      return extention 

125   

126 -def _getdummyname(storefile): 

127      """Provides a dummy name for a file object without a name attribute, by guessing the file type.""" 
128      return 'dummy.' + _guessextention(storefile) 

129   

130 -def _getname(storefile): 

131      """returns the filename""" 
132      if storefile is None: 
133          raise ValueError("This method cannot magically produce a filename when given None as input.") 
134      if not isinstance(storefile, basestring): 
135          if not hasattr(storefile, "name"): 
136              storefilename = _getdummyname(storefile) 
137          else: 
138              storefilename = storefile.name 
139      else: 
140          storefilename = storefile 
141      return storefilename 

142   

143 -def getclass(storefile, ignore=None, classes=classes, hiddenclasses=hiddenclasses): 

144      """Factory that returns the applicable class for the type of file presented. 
145      Specify ignore to ignore some part at the back of the name (like .gz). """ 
146      storefilename = _getname(storefile) 
147      if ignore and storefilename.endswith(ignore): 
148          storefilename = storefilename[:-len(ignore)] 
149      root, ext = os.path.splitext(storefilename) 
150      ext = ext[len(os.path.extsep):].lower() 
151      decomp = None 
152      if ext in decompressclass: 
153          decomp = ext 
154          root, ext = os.path.splitext(root) 
155          ext = ext[len(os.path.extsep):].lower() 
156      if ext in hiddenclasses: 
157          guesserfn = hiddenclasses[ext] 
158          if decomp: 
159              ext = guesserfn(decompressclass[decomp](storefile)) 
160          else: 
161              ext = guesserfn(storefile) 
162      try: 
163          storeclass = classes[ext] 
164      except KeyError: 
165          raise ValueError("Unknown filetype (%s)" % storefilename) 
166      return storeclass 

167   

168 -def getobject(storefile, ignore=None, classes=classes, hiddenclasses=hiddenclasses): 

169      """Factory that returns a usable object for the type of file presented. 
170   
171      @type storefile: file or str 
172      @param storefile: File object or file name. 
173   
174      Specify ignore to ignore some part at the back of the name (like .gz). 
175      """ 
176   
177      if isinstance(storefile, base.TranslationStore): 
178          return storefile 
179      if isinstance(storefile, basestring): 
180          if os.path.isdir(storefile) or storefile.endswith(os.path.sep): 
181              from translate.storage import directory 
182              return directory.Directory(storefile) 
183      storefilename = _getname(storefile) 
184      storeclass = getclass(storefile, ignore, classes=classes, hiddenclasses=hiddenclasses) 
185      if os.path.exists(storefilename) or not getattr(storefile, "closed", True): 
186          name, ext = os.path.splitext(storefilename) 
187          ext = ext[len(os.path.extsep):].lower() 
188          if ext in decompressclass: 
189              storefile = decompressclass[ext](storefilename) 
190          store = storeclass.parsefile(storefile) 
191      else: 
192          store = storeclass() 
193          store.filename = storefilename 
194      return store 

195   

196 -def supported_files(): 

197      """Returns data about all supported files 
198   
199      @return: list of type that include (name, extensions, mimetypes) 
200      @rtype: list 
201      """ 
202   
203      supported = {} 
204      for supported_class in classes.itervalues(): 
205          name = getattr(supported_class, "Name", None) 
206          if name is None: 
207              continue 
208          extensions = getattr(supported_class, "Extensions", None) 
209          mimetypes = getattr(supported_class, "Mimetypes", None) 
210          if not supported.has_key(name): 
211              supported[name] = (extensions, mimetypes) 
212          else: 
213              supported[name][0].extend(extensions) 
214              supported[name][1].extend(mimetypes) 
215      return [(name, ext_mime[0], ext_mime[1]) for name, ext_mime in supported.iteritems()]
